newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Marks & Spencer targets Australian market.
newsitem.headline: Marks & Spencer targets Australian market.

text.p: Marks & Spencer Plc said on Thursday it has targeted Australia in its development plans and would start looking for franchise partners early in 1997.
"Following a lengthy feasibility study, we have decided to enter the Australian market, concentrating initially on Sydney," deputy chairman Keith Oates said in a statement.
The company also said it believed franchising, rather than owning stores, was the best entry strategy.
It now trades in 31 countries globally and has 34 stores in the Asia-Pacific, its statement said.
